Description: A comma-separated list of the conventions that are followed by the dataset. e.g. NUG, ACDD-1.3, CF-1.8, WMO CF-1.0

The date on which this data (including all modifications) were formally issued (i.e., made available to a wider audience). Note that these apply just to the data, not the metadata. The ISO 8601:2004 extended date format shall be used.
The date on which the data was last modified. Note that this applies just to the data, not the metadata. The ISO 8601:2004 extended date format shall be used.

Specifies the type of discrete sampling geometry to which the data in the scope of this attribute belongs, and implies that all data variables in the scope of this attribute contain collections of features of that type.
Mandatory (M), Conditional \(C) or Optio: C - see regulation 6.h, mandatory for discrete sampling geometries.

Description: Describes the data's 2D or 3D geospatial extent in OGC's Well-Known Text (WKT) Geometry format (reference the OGC Simple Feature Access (SFA) specification). The meaning and order of values for each point's coordinates depends on the coordinate reference system (CRS). The ACDD default is 2D geometry in the EPSG:4326 coordinate reference system. The default may be overridden with geospatial_bounds_crs and geospatial_bounds_vertical_crs (see those attributes). EPSG:4326 coordinate values are latitude (decimal degrees_north) and longitude (decimal degrees_east), in that order. Longitude values in the default case are limited to the [-180, 180) range. Example: 'POLYGON ((40.26 -111.29, 41.26 -111.29, 41.26 -110.29, 40.26 -110.29, 40.26 -111.29))'.

The coordinate reference system (CRS) of the point coordinates in the geospatial_bounds attribute. This CRS may be 2-dimensional or 3-dimensional, but together with geospatial_bounds_vertical_crs, if that attribute is supplied, must match the dimensionality, order, and meaning of point coordinate values in the geospatial_bounds attribute. If geospatial_bounds_vertical_crs is also present then this attribute must only specify a 2D CRS. EPSG CRSs are strongly recommended. If this attribute is not specified, the CRS is assumed to be EPSG:4326. Examples: 'EPSG:4979' (the 3D WGS84 CRS), 'EPSG:4047'.

A comma-separated list of key words and/or phrases. Keywords may be common words or phrases, terms from a controlled vocabulary (GCMD is often used), or URIs for terms from a controlled vocabulary (see also "keywords_vocabulary" attribute).

If you are using a controlled vocabulary for the words/phrases in your "keywords" attribute, this is the unique name or identifier of the vocabulary from which keywords are taken. If more than one keyword vocabulary is used, each may be presented with a prefix and a following comma, so that keywords may optionally be prefixed with the controlled vocabulary key. Example: 'GCMD:GCMD Keywords, CF:NetCDF COARDS Climate and Forecast Standard Names'.
Options are: WMOEssential, WMOAdditional, WMOOther, NoLimitation
A textual description of the processing (or quality control) level of the data.
The email address of the person (or other entity specified by the publisher_type attribute) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format.
The name of the person (or other entity specified by the publisher_type attribute) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format.
The URL of the person (or other entity specified by the publisher_type attribute) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format.

The name and version of the controlled vocabulary from which variable standard names are taken. (Values for any standard_name attribute must come from the CF Standard Names vocabulary for the data file or product to comply with CF.) Example: 'CF Standard Name Table v27'.
A paragraph describing the dataset, analogous to an abstract for a paper.
Describes the duration of the data set. The extended ISO 8601:2004 duration format shall be used.
Describes the time of the last data point in the data set. The extended ISO 8601:2004 date format shall be used.
Describes the targeted or typical time period between each value in the data set. The extended ISO 8601:2004 duration format shall be used.
Describes the time of the first data point in the data set. The extended 8601:2004 date format shall be used.
Short description of the file contents.
The WMO CF profile used to represent the data contained within the file.
The type of data contained within the file according to Common Code Table C-13
The originator of the data according to Common Code Table C-11.
The originating sub centre for the data if different from the `wmo__originating_centre`. See common code table C-12

Indicator as to whether the data are original or updated. The rules shall follow those defined for BUFR in Volume I.2 (zero for original messages and for messages containing only delayed reports; incremented for other updates).
The traditional WMO identifier for the observing station/platform.
The WIGOS Station Identifier (WSI) for the observing station/platform.
